content: I have a formal question on #20977: this is code from @Rémy Degenne and @Peter Pfaffelhuber, from their project on the Kolmogorv extension. To help them upstreaming, I have created the branch and made a minor cleanup (a first review, if you like). Am I still in a position to review the branch and merge it in the end, or is it better if it's done by someone else? In such cases, does it look reasonable if I'm entitled to a maintainer merge but not a bors merge, for instance?
maintainer merge is definitely fine. But I would claim that a minor cleanup is innocent enough that even bors merge is still fine.
The alternative is being stuck because almost all the people capable of reviewing this were involved in the PR, right? (this keeps on happening to Bhavik and I)
Yes, the alternative is being stuck. As a middle ground, I've maintainer merged the PR.
